meanings.definition: Buy back something that was previously sold.
meanings.sent1: After selling my old bike, I decided to repurchase it when I realized how much I missed it.
meanings.sent2: She repurchased her childhood home after saving up enough money.
meanings.sent3: I had to repurchase my own book from the bookstore because I accidentally gave away my only copy.
meanings.sent4: The antique collector couldn't resist the urge to repurchase the rare vase she had sold years ago.
meanings.sent5: The company had to repurchase all the faulty products to maintain their reputation for quality.

meanings.sent1: I had to repurchase my favorite sweater after losing it on a trip.
meanings.sent2: He repurchased the concert tickets after accidentally deleting the email with the QR code.
meanings.sent3: She had to repurchase the same gift for her friend's birthday because she forgot she already bought it.
meanings.sent4: The bakery had to repurchase ingredients for the cake after realizing they were expired.
meanings.sent5: The student had to repurchase the textbook because the first one got damaged in a rainstorm.
